summary: This document contains notes from an April 3, 2020 phone call with a victim, identified as 'A', regarding her recollections of traveling with and being abused by Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell. The victim corrects the timeline of a specific trip to see 'The Lion King' but remains confident about the overall pattern of abuse starting when she was 14.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: Described as bragging about knowing Julie Taymor and securing difficult-to-get theater tickets. The victim states she was abused by him during approximately 90% of her trips to New York.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: Described by the victim as being present and involved in the abuse from early on during the victim's trips to New York.

persons.name: Julie Taymor
persons.context: Mentioned as a person Epstein claimed to know and bragged about in an attempt to impress the victim during a trip to see 'The Lion King'.

connections.description: Epstein is accused of sexually abusing 'A' during approximately 90% of her trips to New York, starting when she was 14.
Maxwell is described by 'A' as being present and involved in the abuse from early on during the trips.
Both are implicated by the victim in the coordinated sexual abuse during her trips to New York.
Epstein bragged to the victim that he knew Julie Taymor, the director of 'The Lion King', in an attempt to impress her.

events.title: Premiere of The Lion King on Broadway
events.description: The Broadway show 'The Lion King' premiered. The victim initially associated a trip with this premiere but later realized her recollection of the timing was mistaken.

events.title: Trip to see The Lion King
events.description: A trip to New York City where Epstein took the victim to see 'The Lion King'. Epstein bragged about knowing director Julie Taymor and having secured excellent, hard-to-get seats.

events.title: Series of Abuse in New York
events.description: The victim recalls that during approximately 90% (nine out of ten) of her trips to New York, she was sexually abused by Epstein or Epstein and Maxwell.

events.title: Notable Trip to New Mexico
events.description: A trip to New Mexico that the victim specifically recalls as being notable and unusual because she was not sexually abused during it.

events.title: FBI Follow-up Phone Call with Victim
events.description: The FBI team conducted a follow-up phone call with victim 'A' to clarify details of her testimony, including the timeline of a specific trip.

keyFacts: The victim ('A') remains very confident that she started traveling to New York City to visit Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell when she was 14 years old.
The victim states that during approximately 90% (nine out of ten) of her trips to New York, she was sexually abused by Epstein or by Epstein and Maxwell together.
The victim specifically recalls a trip to New Mexico as being notable because it was an unusual instance where she was not sexually abused.
The victim corrected her initial timeline, realizing a memorable trip to see 'The Lion King' on Broadway would have been after the show's 1997 premiere, not coinciding with it.
The document indicates ongoing FBI investigation and witness testimony clarification as of April 2020.
